meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of a siphon.
meanings.sent1: The syphonic tube efficiently transferred the liquid from one container to another.
meanings.sent2: The syphonic system in the lab helped in moving the water without any spills.
meanings.sent3: The syphonic design of the fountain made it look like magic as the water flowed upwards.
meanings.sent4: Her syphonic explanation of the process made everything clear in an instant.
meanings.sent5: The syphonic mechanism was so smooth that it seemed like a dance of water.

meanings.sent1: The syphonic method was used to empty the tank quickly.
meanings.sent2: The syphonic process required careful handling to avoid any spills.
meanings.sent3: The syphonic technique was so effective that it almost seemed like magic.
meanings.sent4: Her syphonic approach to the problem saved a lot of time and effort.
meanings.sent5: The syphonic operation was so smooth that it impressed everyone watching.

meanings.definition: To draw off or convey through a siphon.
meanings.sent1: He syphoniced the water from the bucket into the sink.
meanings.sent2: She syphoniced the fuel from the tank into the container.
meanings.sent3: The magician seemed to syphonic the liquid out of thin air.
meanings.sent4: The thief tried to syphonic the money from the safe, but he got caught.
meanings.sent5: The chef had to syphonic the excess oil from the pan to avoid a mess.
